Trees.name: Japanese Maple
Trees.description: Japanese Maple is a deciduous tree known for its stunning foliage and graceful form. It typically grows 10-25 feet tall with a spread of 10-20 feet. The leaves vary in color from deep red to purple or green depending on the cultivar. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it ideal for enhancing gardens and landscapes with its vibrant colors throughout the seasons.

Trees.name: Crepe Myrtle
Trees.description: Crepe Myrtle is a small to medium-sized deciduous tree renowned for its showy summer flowers and attractive bark. It typically grows 10-30 feet tall with a spread of 6-15 feet. Flower colors range from white to shades of pink, red, or purple, depending on the cultivar. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.

Trees.name: Dogwood
Trees.description: Dogwood is a small to medium-sized flowering tree native to North America, prized for its elegant white or pink spring flowers and attractive fall foliage. It typically grows 15-30 feet tall with a spread of 15-25 feet. It prefers partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for gardens and woodland edges.

Trees.name: Eastern Redbud
Trees.description: Eastern Redbud is a small deciduous tree known for its striking pink or purple flowers that bloom on bare branches in early spring. It typically grows 20-30 feet tall with a spread of 15-25 feet. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, tolerating drought once established. It adds color to landscapes and attracts bees and butterflies.

Trees.name: Magnolia
Trees.description: Magnolia is a large genus of flowering trees known for their large, fragrant flowers and glossy foliage. They range from 20-30 feet tall with a spread of 15-25 feet, depending on the species. Magnolias prefer full sun to partial shade and well-drained, acidic soil. They are popular ornamental trees in gardens and parks, providing beauty and fragrance.

Trees.name: Cherry Tree
Trees.description: Cherry trees are deciduous trees known for their spring blossoms and edible fruits. They vary in height from 15-30 feet with a spread of 10-20 feet. Flower colors range from white to pink depending on the cultivar. Cherry trees prefer full sun and well-drained soil, making them popular in orchards and home gardens.

Trees.name: Holly
Trees.description: Hollies are evergreen trees or shrubs known for their glossy, spiky leaves and bright berries. They range from 6-20 feet tall with a spread of 4-12 feet. Hollies thrive in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, attracting birds with their berries. They are used for hedges, privacy screens, and ornamental purposes in gardens.

Trees.name: Japanese Flowering Cherry
Trees.description: Japanese Flowering Cherry is a small to medium-sized tree known for its spectacular spring blossoms. It typically grows 15-25 feet tall with a spread of 10-15 feet. Flower colors range from white to pink, depending on the cultivar. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, adding beauty to gardens and landscapes.

Trees.name: American Red Maple
Trees.description: American Red Maple is a large deciduous tree prized for its brilliant red foliage in autumn. It typically grows 40-70 feet tall with a spread of 25-45 feet. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, providing shade and attracting wildlife. It is widely used in parks, residential areas, and urban landscapes.

Trees.name: Birch
Trees.description: Birches are deciduous trees known for their graceful form and distinctive bark. They typically grow 40-70 feet tall with a spread of 20-40 feet. Birches prefer full sun to partial shade and moist, well-drained soil. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are often used in parks and large landscapes.

Trees.name: Willow
Trees.description: Willows are deciduous trees known for their graceful, weeping branches and fast growth. They typically grow 30-50 feet tall with a spread of 20-35 feet. Willows prefer moist to wet soil and full sun to partial shade. They provide shade and are suitable for adding a dramatic element to landscapes.

Trees.name: Linden
Trees.description: Lindens are large deciduous trees known for their heart-shaped leaves and fragrant flowers. They typically grow 50-70 feet tall with a spread of 35-50 feet. Lindens prefer full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil. They are valued for their shade, attractive foliage, and ability to attract pollinators like bees.

Trees.name: Oak
Trees.description: Oak trees are large deciduous or evergreen trees known for their strength and longevity. They typically grow 50-80 feet tall with a spread of 40-60 feet. Oaks prefer full sun and well-drained soil. They support a diverse range of wildlife and are valued for their shade and majestic presence in landscapes.

Trees.name: spruce
Trees.description: Spruces are large evergreen trees known for their conical shape and needle-like foliage. They typically grow 30-60 feet tall with a spread of 10-20 feet. Spruces prefer full sun and well-drained soil. They are valued for their year-round greenery and are used as windbreaks or privacy screens in landscapes.
